content.description: Find the low side pull then move through the middle using crimps. Then enjoy the juggy top out right of the tree.
content.location: Right of Drop, Lock, and Pocket

content.description: Begin with a sit start under the rock on the left side of the boulder. Find the good holds to pullup and out from under the rock. Then finish with a slabby jug hull to the top.
Start at the bottom of the Arete and follow the good holds to the top.
content.location: Behind the big double boulder.

content.description: Use the ledge to start and follow the crimps to move towards the arete. Then use the jugs and finish on top of the arete.
content.location: On a "ball" like boulder on the uphill side of the RockHouse trail. This problem is on the other face next to Three Star Face and right of Food Evolution.

content.description: Use the two pockets at the start to move to a pocket on the left. Then bust a move to the jugs for a top out right of the tree.
content.location: Right of You Got Me Sweaty

content.description: Face climb with an arete
Start with a match on the lower flake then move through the slightly overhanging face with jugs for the top out.
content.location: Uphill side of the RockHouse trail on the back inner wall of the "ball" like boulder.

content.description: Sit start with good jugs on the bottom of the arete. Then move under the mini roof to the slopy top out.
content.location: This is a small boulder on the down hillside from the "ball" like boulder. It is a small boulder on the right side of the Rockhouse trail coming form Sells parking lot.

content.description: Start between the two cracks and follow the crimps to a top out on the right.
content.location: Right of mini dihedral

content.description: Sit start under the low shelf. Then move high and follow the traverse to a good ledge for the finish.
content.location: This is the middle boulder on the uphill side of the Rockhouse Trail. Its most notable mark is the sloped roof, and the boulder sits on a 2-foot ledge.

content.description: Start underneath the roof on the smallest block feature. Move underneath the roof and out on to the ledge of the roof. Then find the good hold in the crack to top out.
content.location: This is the upper boulder on the uphill side of the trail. The boulder has a small roof and a slopy top. The problem starts under the roof on the smallest block-like feature.

content.description: Climb the good holds to the slopey top out.
Find the good feet to start. Then move to the pocket for a finish with nice jugs moving left of the tree.
content.location: Right of Hot Pocket

content.description: Begin with good crimps and follow them to the jug line. Follow jugs to top out left of the tree
content.location: Right of Fake Flake

content.description: Start with a low crimping side pull and a high left crimp. Move up the sloping arete to finish by using the footholds on the overhanging face.
content.location: Behind the first boulder on the up hillsides of the Rockhouse Trail. Or the boulder immediately on the left if using approach trail.

content.description: Start in between the two rock faces that are divided by a small crack. Then enjoy the smallish holds and steeming moves to the top out towards the right.
content.location: Righ of Dextrose

content.description: Same start as Slope Star, finish with a top out using the upper crack.
content.location: This is the upper boulder with a large roof on the uphill side of the trail.

content.description: Use the crips to the horizontal flake then go for the jugs for a top out left of the tree.
content.location: Right of Much

content.description: Sit start in the obvious pocket and work a couple moves to the solid top-out. Watch out for the rock close behind your head.
content.location: At the far (west-most) end of COAD area. Standalone boulder with a heart-shaped face. Slightly downhill of the cave in the cliff face and at the same elevation line as Three Star Face.

content.description: A fun matching start in a medium-size pocket. Then finishing on a jug and sloper to top out.
content.location: On the "ball" like boulder on the uphill side of the trial. Right of Cutleaf Toothwort.

content.description: Begin with a sit start and move up and over the bulge to a sloper section. Then use the good handholds and fun slaby footholds to top out.
content.location: This route is on the uphill side of the Rockhouse trial pass PawPaw Connector trail. It is on the boulder that is home to Whale Belly, located on the opposite side just left of the arete.

content.description: Start with a match on a low ledge. Move through the crimps and towards the pocket. Then use the good jugs to top out.
content.location: The uphill side of the RockHouse trail on the right face of Broken Glass.

content.description: Start with a two-pocket start and use good crimps to the top out.
content.location: Right of Bobcat Crack

content.description: Follow the jugs to the mantle top out.
Follow the flake to a top out left of the tree.
content.location: Right of Up and Up

content.description: Start with the crimps at the bottom and move to the left side of the pocket. The find the good jugs to top out right of the tree.
content.location: Right of Pocket Putty

content.description: Start left of the mini dihedral and follow the slab-like rock to finish on the left.
content.location: This is the farthest route on the left side of the wall.

content.description: Begin with a sit start using high handholds on the arete. Then use a mix of good holds and good crimps to top out on the taller side of the boulder.
content.location: On the "ball" like boulder on the uphill side of the trial. This problem is on the opposite side of the boulder of where Three Star Face and Broken Glass are.

content.description: Begin with a match in a hand size pocket. Move up and left for good holds and top out at the peak of the boulder.
content.location: This is the wedge-like boulder on the uphill side of the RockHouse trail after PawPaw Connector. The climb is on the far right side on the vertical face portion of this boulder.

content.description: A fun and finger focused route also great options for feet.
content.location: The ridge at the top of the hill which is home to most of the problems at COAD.

content.description: Follow the good jugs across the rock face. Great climb to do while waiting for a problem to open up. Also, it is good to work the feet and improve endurance.
content.location: This is the ridge on top of the hill that is home to the majority of the problems at COAD.

content.description: Start at the indent of the arete and find the good feet. Then follow the arete to the top out.
content.location: This is the wedge-like a boulder on the uphill side of the Rockhouse Trail after PawPaw Connector. This climb shares the same arete with Free From.

content.description: Sit start, then use the arete and good crimps on the right to finish on a slab-like top out.
content.location: Uphill side of the RockHouse trail on the back inner wall of the "ball" like boulder. Right of Little.

content.description: Start below the crack and move into the good holds in the crack. Then follow the holds to the top out.
content.location: Right of spoons not forks

content.description: Use jugs and underclings with a crag near the top
content.location: Downhill and S of Fire in the Hole

content.description: Start with a crimp and a sloper pinch. Move to the good crimp and flow through the slopey top out.
content.location: This climb is on the far end (opposite of the crack) on top of the hill on the ridge that hosts most of the climbs.

content.description: Secluded sandstone boulders over East State Street.
